newsitem.title: USA: CompuServe falls after Q2 forecast.
newsitem.headline: CompuServe falls after Q2 forecast.

text.p: Shares of CompuServe Corp tumbled about 10 percent after the online service forecast an even greater than expected second quarter loss, due to more delays with the next generation of its service.

CompuServe fell 1-1/8 to 9-3/8 in active trading, bringing its shares to a new year low. The online service went public in April at $30 a share, but its shares have drifted lower after two quarters of losses and a slowdown in subscribers.
"They keep having problems getting this out the door," said Abhishek Gami, an analyst with Nesbitt Burns Securities, referring to the new version of CompuServe, version 3.0.
CompuServe said that it initially had scheduled to begin volume shipments of the 3.0 Interface software in September but that it is now being distributed throughout October.

Analysts said that the new software has gone through several delays, but one upside is that it is a very competitive product that may finally put CompuServe on the same playing field as the leader America Online Inc and with the new version of Microsoft Corp's MSN.
CompuServe is hoping that the new Web-based version of its software will held reduce its customer attrition and improve its profitability.
